Off the Beaten Path

El Cuyo

entry.title: Destination of the Month
entry.content:
Destination of the Month

Kowloon

One of the most densely populated cities on Earth, Hong Kong's mainland portion offers a culture less influenced by the British than the neighboring Island, plus accommodation, dining, and nightlife are generally cheaper.

entry.title: Doot Doot (6 7)
entry.content: ... that the single "Doot Doot (6 7)" inspired a viral meme phrase that was named Dictionary.com's 2025 Word of the Year?

entry.title: Daaga
entry.content: ... that Daaga was freed from a slave ship by the Royal Navy, but executed by the British Army less than a year later?

entry.title: Prime Inc.
entry.content: ... that American trucking company Prime Inc. sued Amazon over its use of the Amazon Prime logo?

entry.title: Violin Concerto
entry.content: ... that Khachaturian's Violin Concerto incorporates several themes from Armenian folk songs?

entry.title: Sperry S-1
entry.content: ... that the US Army Air Corps ordered the Sperry S-1 bombsight because supplies of the Norden bombsight were controlled by the US Navy?

entry.title: Archivea kewensis
entry.content: ... that the orchid species Archivea kewensis is known only from an 1823 watercolour painting?

entry.title: Gholdengo
entry.content: ... that Gholdengo has been jokingly described as looking like a "walking Ponzi scheme"?

entry.title: Yi Peng festival
entry.content: ... that sky lanterns released during the Yi Peng festival (pictured) cause Chiang Mai International Airport to cancel and reschedule flights every year?

entry.title: Paper Girl
entry.content: ... that Paper Girl concluded that the super-rich are removing the "ladder of upward mobility" from the lower class?
